item.title: A common misunderstanding about `reduce`
item.description: Misconception I’ve read in several places that reduce reduces an array1 of values to a single one. The main characteristic of this function is not to reduce to a ‘smaller element’ / ‘single element’, but to have access to the accumulated results and the elements, one by one. Quoting Mozilla Developer Network’s (MDN) Javascript reference: The reduce() method applies a function against an accumulator and each value of the array (from left-to-right) to reduce it to a single value.
